questions.question_text: You want to pull out of a driveway across the pavement onto the roadway. What must you look out for first?

options.b: The speed of traffic on the main road

questions.explanation: Before your vehicle even reaches the roadway, it must cross the pavement. Your first priority is to check for pedestrians and children who may be on that pavement.

questions.question_text: By mistake, you have taken the right-hand lane but wish to turn left. What do you do?

options.a: Stop and reverse into the correct lane
options.b: Proceed straight ahead or turn right
options.c: Turn left from the right-hand lane

questions.explanation: If you find yourself in the wrong lane at an intersection, you must not make a sudden or illegal turn. You must follow the direction indicated for the lane you are in.

questions.question_text: What is a key principle of the zipper feed-in method when a lane comes to an end?

options.a: Drivers in the continuing lane must allow vehicles from the ending lane to move in
options.b: Drivers in the ending lane must stop and wait for a large gap
options.c: The larger vehicle always has priority

questions.explanation: The zipper feed-in method requires co-operation. Drivers in the lane that is continuing must allow vehicles from the lane that is ending to merge one by one, like a zipper.

questions.question_text: You are approaching the vehicles in this picture. What must you do?

options.a: Watch if the truck and trailer remain on the hard shoulder
options.b: Accelerate and pass before the truck has a chance to move
options.c: Flash your headlights to assert your right of way

questions.explanation: When approaching a large vehicle on the hard shoulder, you must be prepared for it to enter the roadway. The correct action is to watch it carefully and anticipate its movements.

questions.question_text: Is it irresponsible to overtake a truck and trailer before a crossroads?

options.a: No, it is safe as long as you accelerate quickly
options.b: Yes, because the truck and trailer can obscure the view of the crossing traffic
options.c: No, trucks are required to yield to overtaking cars

questions.explanation: Overtaking a large vehicle near a crossroads is extremely dangerous because it can completely block your view of traffic that may be entering from the side road.

questions.question_text: What must you reckon with in this situation?

options.a: The cyclist will stop for you
options.b: The cyclist will pass the parked car on the left
options.c: The cyclist will stay behind the parked car

questions.explanation: You must anticipate that the cyclist will manoeuvre around the parked car by moving left into your path. You also have to be aware of potential oncoming traffic.

questions.question_text: In which instances is overtaking always prohibited?

options.c: On roads with a speed limit of 60 km/h

questions.explanation: Overtaking is always prohibited at blind spots (crests of hills, sharp corners) where you do not have a clear and sufficient view of the road ahead.

questions.question_text: Why could overtaking be dangerous in this situation?

options.a: The road ahead is clear for overtaking
options.b: The other cars are driving too slowly
options.c: Slush could be thrown up and impair visibility

questions.explanation: Driving through slush at speed can throw it up onto your windscreen, suddenly and severely impairing your visibility, which is extremely dangerous while in the opposing lane.

questions.question_text: What must you do when a car is overtaking you, but oncoming traffic has come dangerously close?

options.a: Accelerate to create more space behind you
options.c: Reduce speed and drive as far as possible over on the left

questions.explanation: To help avoid a head-on collision, you must assist the overtaking driver by reducing your speed and moving as far to the left as is safe, creating more space for them to pull in.

questions.question_text: You are driving on a road in heavy traffic and have moved into the lane for turning left. At the crossroads, you realize that you wanted to turn right. What do you do?

options.a: Turn left and accept that you have to make a detour
options.b: Stop in the intersection and wait to merge right
options.c: Quickly cut across the lanes to turn right

questions.explanation: Once you are committed to a lane at a crossroads, you must follow through. The safe and correct action is to make the left turn and find another route (make a detour).

questions.question_text: You are waiting at a traffic light and want to turn right. What should you remember?

options.a: You must make sure there is no road user beside you on the right intending to go straight on
options.b: You have absolute priority as soon as the light turns green
options.c: You should turn before checking for cyclists or pedestrians

questions.explanation: When turning right, you must be vigilant for cyclists or other road users who may be proceeding straight on from your right side, as they have the right of way.

questions.question_text: You want to turn right. Who must you give way to?

options.a: You have priority over all other road users
options.b: Pedestrians wishing to cross the road you are turning into

questions.explanation: When turning, you must always give way to pedestrians who are crossing the road you are entering.

questions.question_text: What can give rise to particularly dangerous situations where several lanes turn off?
questions.explanation: Driving too fast or changing lanes while turning can be very dangerous in multi-lane turning situations, as it reduces reaction time and can lead to collisions.

questions.question_text: You want to turn left into a priority road. To which road users you pay particular attention?

options.a: Only to vehicles approaching from the right
options.b: Vehicles approaching from the left and from the right
options.c: Only to pedestrians on the pavement

questions.explanation: When entering a priority road, you must give way to all traffic already on that road, which means paying attention to vehicles from both directions.

questions.question_text: What must you do when reversing?

options.a: Drive with particular attention and slowly
options.b: Reverse quickly to avoid obstructing traffic
options.c: Rely only on your rear-view mirror

questions.explanation: Reversing is a dangerous manoeuvre. It must always be done slowly and with particular attention to your surroundings, checking all mirrors and blind spots.
